topic.title: Hello, ZeroNet :)
topic.body:
Hi everyone!

I just read about ZeroNet on TorrentFreak and started testing it right away. It's a very interesting concept and very well implemented as well. Kudos to the developers and supporters.

/** Shameless plug =) */
I'm part of the coreteam of a similar project called Sneer (https://github.com/sneerteam/sneer). For now we just have an Android client but web and desktop clients are coming out this year. The main client is a chat app similar to Telegram, Signal, etc, and it's possible to develop plugins that we call SneerApps, to extend it's functionality, make games, so on so forth. 

We are still using a central server but we plan to go P2P sometime in the future. You can check our (outdated) roadmap here: https://trello.com/b/lEdEIxxA/sneer.

Cheers!

topic.title: How to buy NMC with BTC?
topic.body:
Hi, everyone.

Does anyone know any other way to buy NMC with BTC? I was trying ShapeShift but, apparently, it no longer works with NameCoin.

Thanks in advance :)

topic.title: The Blockchain News
topic.body:
Read articles about cryptocurrencies, P2P technology and more without leaving the ZeroNet network.

http://127.0.0.1:43110/bcnews.bit/

Disclaimer: All articles reposted there were originally distributed under the Creative Commons license.

topic.title: TBCNews - Pirate Bay founder : Streaming model could ignite new piracy war
topic.body:
"As streaming services such as Netflix and Spotify gain even greater traction, so does the centralization of online content that consumers no longer own. According to Pirate Bay founder Peter Sunde this business model holds subscribers to ransom, with the threat of content being suddenly taken away now a constant threat."

Read more -> http://127.0.0.1:43110/bcnews.bit/?Post:12:Pirate+Bay+founder:+Streaming+model+could+ignite+new+piracy+war

topic.title: TBCNews - UK govt pushes 10 years jail for online pirates
topic.body:
The UK government has published its conclusions following a consultation into punishments for online copyright infringement offenses. At the earliest opportunity Parliament will be asked to increase custodial sentences up to a maximum of 10 years while ensuring that unwitting pirates are protected.



Read more -> http://127.0.0.1:43110/bcnews.bit/?Post:14

topic.title: TBCNews - Prince gave a file-hosting site a personal 30 min piracy lecture
topic.body:
After the sad passing of Prince yesterday, people have been paying tribute to the superstar musician. According to the operator of a file-hosting site that was hosting unauthorized copies of his tracks, Prince once personally called him on his cellphone and gave him a 30 minute talk on the perils of piracy.

Read more -> http://127.0.0.1:43110/bcnews.bit/

topic.title: TBCNews - Fan-created movie subtitle site operator facing prison
topic.body:
The operator of a site that hosted fan-made translated movie subtitles has been prosecuted in Sweden. Undertexter.se was raided by police in the summer of 2013, despite many feeling that the site had done nothing wrong. That is disputed by the prosecutor who says that the crimes committed are worthy of imprisonment.

Read more -> http://127.0.0.1:43110/bcnews.bit/?Post:18:New+blog+post

topic.title: TBCNews - Youtube threatens legal action against video downloader
topic.body:
YouTube continues to crack down on sites and services that allow people to download videos from the site. Most recently, YouTube urged the operator of TubeNinja to cease his activities, or face potential legal action instead. For now, however, the video download service has no plans to change its course.

Read more ->  http://127.0.0.1:43110/bcnews.bit/?Post:19:Youtube+threatens+legal+action+against+video+downloader

topic.title: TBCNews - Paramount cracks down on "The Godfather" pirates, after 44 years
topic.body:
The all-time classic The Godfather is not too far away from its 50 year anniversary, but that doesn't mean Paramount Pictures is letting people pirate the movie without consequences. Over the past several months the movie studio has sent warnings targeting alleged pirates, including a mention of a potential lawsuit.


Read more -> http://127.0.0.1:43110/bcnews.bit/?Home

topic.title: TBCNews - Youtuber sued over Stanley Kubrick movies analysis
topic.body:
A YouTube user who creates video essays has been hit with a punishing lawsuit after selecting Stanley Kubrick as a subject matter and uploading his work to YouTube. UK-based Lewis Bond from Channel Criswell is being targeted by the music publishers behind the 1971 classic 'A Clockwork Orange' who want huge damages for willful infringement.

Read more -> http://127.0.0.1:43110/bcnews.bit/?Post:22:Youtuber+sued+over+Stanley+Kubrick+movies+analysis

1_1FieP4c1gxFme5webFJB9x5ZPBXdR6p3Fs.body: oops, the title should be "Hello, ZeroNet" =P

> [nippletwister](#comment_158_1PvAyLAB5H1JKbiFjx95ZJXrNJVyWxs5Hf): You can edit your own titles and messages easily.

Hi, @nippletwister . Hmm I tried but there's no "edit" button or something like that o0. Can you teach me how to do that, please?

> [nippletwister](#comment_158_1PvAyLAB5H1JKbiFjx95ZJXrNJVyWxs5Hf): You can edit your own titles and messages easily.

Hey, I've found it. I use NoScript and it was blocking the remote font used for that. I whitelisted it for this session.

Thanks!

15_1PvAyLAB5H1JKbiFjx95ZJXrNJVyWxs5Hf.body:
Hi!

I'm part of the coreteam of a similar project called Sneer (https://github.com/sneerteam/sneer). For now we just have an Android client but web and desktop clients are coming out this year. The main client is a chat app similar to Telegram, Signal, etc, and it's possible to develop plugins that we call SneerApps, to extend it's functionality, make games, so on so forth.

We are still using a central server but we plan to go P2P sometime in the future. You can check our (outdated) roadmap here: https://trello.com/b/lEdEIxxA/sneer.

Btw, ZeroNet is awesome! :)

10_1PvAyLAB5H1JKbiFjx95ZJXrNJVyWxs5Hf.body:
Sorting ZeroTalk's comments. I like to start by the first comment right after reading the post. I think it's more natural.

Threaded comments like on Reddit and HN are good too.

What kind of apps do you have in mind? I'm not a js dev but I've used a little bit of ClojureScript for web. I work with Clojure and Android so maybe I could help with some JS as well.

I'll copy and paste my presentation from another post:

"I'm part of the coreteam of a similar project called Sneer (https://github.com/sneerteam/sneer). For now we just have an Android client but web and desktop clients are coming out this year. The main client is a chat app similar to Telegram, Signal, etc, and it's possible to develop plugins that we call SneerApps, to extend it's functionality, make games, so on so forth.

We are still using a central server but we plan to go P2P sometime in the future. You can check our (outdated) roadmap here: https://trello.com/b/lEdEIxxA/sneer.

Btw, ZeroNet is awesome! :)"

2_1GCsW9TFfjDsvcdmKPADq1n8Q3ha72UtDQ.body:
Clojure, Scheme and Java.

Yeah, I know what you're thinking:
"Java??? What the hell? Everybody hates Java..." and so on...

I used to be one of those Java haters until I had to work with it. It's a very ok language and the JVM is an incredible piece of software. You should try it ;)

3_1FieP4c1gxFme5webFJB9x5ZPBXdR6p3Fs.body:
> [pycole](#comment_133_1KwTTgPRSTHFmmJAFBt6kQfdyNeSM5KJuH): No peers so far--would you mind visiting your site on a proxy to help?

Hey, thanks for the tip. This is my first zite :)

> [pycole](#comment_133_1KwTTgPRSTHFmmJAFBt6kQfdyNeSM5KJuH): No peers so far--would you mind visiting your site on a proxy to help?

hmm it keeps saying NO PEERS FOUND.

[UPDATE] PEERS FOUND: 3 :) What should I do now?

[UPDATE] CONTENT.JSON DOWNLOAD FAILED :( 
1 FILE UPDATE FAILED :(

Maybe it has something to do with the port 15441?

"Your port 15441 is closed. You are still fine, but for faster experience try open it."

Unfortunately I'm on a public network and I don't have access to the router. Any thoughts on that, @pycole?

> [pycole](#comment_134_1KwTTgPRSTHFmmJAFBt6kQfdyNeSM5KJuH): I can still visit the site, so that's not a problem.Check your site's folder in data/1HFp6UZeK73Vt23NSGEUJs5wfJru9eGAT3. You should have a file called content.json which lists all the files your site has. It should look something like this one.

Hey, it's working. I forgot to sign and publish the content.json file. I thought it'd be done automagically hahah. Thanks, man.

> [pycole](#comment_135_1KwTTgPRSTHFmmJAFBt6kQfdyNeSM5KJuH): Great! Out of curiosity: are you copying news to the zite manually, or do you have some kind of automation going on?

Only manually for now. But I do want to automate it soon.

> [yo](#comment_10_1GtJqyJRsuZhmxVtw5USgvqGbUmVH7EmBD): u need a rss to html

Yeah, it'd be handy. Any suggestions?
